Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, clean and convenient, but cheap for a reason.”
Reviews.Author: VikingQueen90
Reviews.Content: Before I write anything else, I need to say that my good opinion is mostly based on value for money. We paid 30 euros per night (double room, shared bathroom, stayed in February 2012) and what we got for such a small price was very decent. However, everything in this hotel matches the price so, in case you want more room and luxury, you should look further. Having said that, the price wasn't the only good thing about the hotel. Everyone at the reception was very polite and ready to help with everything we needed. The location is pretty convenient, since it's close to a few bus/tram stations, but the neighbourhood gives out a somewhat sketchy vibe during nighttime. We had no problems during our stay, though. The hotel seemed rather clean, even the bathrooms (as clean as a shared bathroom can be), and our room was cleaned on regular basis. Breakfast was okay - great for the price - and it's pretty much what lots of people would have at home (bread, jam, cold cuts, boiled eggs, cereals, fruit etc). They also have vending machines at the receptions; one of them offer fast food - FAR from good, but it comes in handy if you get hungry in the middle of the night. As for the downsides, the biggest one is the quality of sleep. I'm not talking about the beds here, they were comfortable, albeit tiny. The walls are, however, very thin and you can hear people talking fairly quietly in the room next to yours (let alone the ones who yell in the middle of the night without taking other tourists into account). Be prepared to wake up in the middle of the night... more than once. Also, everything is miniature. Rooms are the size of a toilet and toilets are the size of a cupboard. While small rooms weren't the issue for us, the tiny shower room was uncomfortable at times - and by tiny I mean if-you-are-a-bigger-person-you-might-not-be-able-to-fit tiny. Once you get in, you have to stand in the shower in order to close the door. The stairs might also be a problem if your luggage is bulky and/or heavy, since they're steep and narrow. Overall, this hotel might seem crammed and tiny, but, when you can get it at a price this small, it's a great budget option.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs- Stay Clear”
Reviews.Author: StrwberSortcak
Reviews.Content: stayed here in 2009, since it was a cheap alternative to many of the expensive hotels in Amsterdam. I woke up the next day and had well over 150 bites all over my body. My friend also had well over 100 bites. We did some online research, and found out that they were bed bug bites. The manager accused us for having them, and bringing them to his hotel, but when he examined the room, the beds were infested, and so were 2-3 of the rooms on the same floor. Ew, it was one of the most aweful experiences I have ever had. As it turned out I had an allergic reaction to all the bites and had to go to the emergency room. I would give this hotel negative stars if I could.

Reviews.Title: “And There was a BURGULAR ...”
Reviews.Author: missky27
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hostel because it was really cheap and we did not want to spend our entire budget on hotel. blah blah So the room was really small which was not so bad. it had a shower and hand basin but no toilet. The toilet is shared between each level and its so small your knees hit the door when your sitting down. There was a sliding door that led out to a court yard out the back but you were not aloud to smoke out there (cigarettes.. No really just Cigarettes) so you had to go and stand in the street out the front to have a cig. It did have free wifi but it was really slow the breakfast was ok One night when we returned back to flipper the doorman took forever to answer when the door finally was opened a man came running out of the front followed by a woman who upon seeing us at the front door pretended to look at brochures and casually left . then the Hotel manager came out from the back room looking shocked saying he had just been robbed!! Bizarro World he did not appear injured so we asked for our key and left him there to call The police Its quite Far from Dam Sqaure I would stay somewhere else next time I return to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_P86
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of this hotel I expected the worst, however when we saw our room we were pleasantly surprised as it's all we really needed in a hotel room....somewhere to sleep (although the beds were so narrow)! Granted, our room didn't have our own toilet but we had quite a good shower (albeit small). However, the hotel in general didn't seem very safe and was a long way from the centre of the city. The surrounding area was not too bad with some nice restaurants and bars. The worst thing about the hotel however is the price they charge! I knew there would be a 5% city tax but no where do they mention that they charge an extra 5% for credit or debit cards....never have I experienced this in my life! On the whole, it wasn't as bad as I thought but there must be so many places in Amsterdam which offer better value for money so I would definitely look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I ever seen”
Reviews.Author: elfakiuk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel a couple of days ago. My first night was a nightmare as I wasn't able to sleep. The room is so small, hot and I was scratching until early hours of the morning. It looks like it has bed bugs. The path room is so small and the shower is less than the size of a middle person. At the end I gave up two days booking and I found another hotel. Just to mention the breakfast is terrible and to find the hotel is another story. I never imagined there is such hotel in Europe. My advice is to stay away from it.

Reviews.Title: “This is FRAUD!”
Reviews.Author: Arehiril
Reviews.Content: I was going to Amsterdam for business reason and decided to stay in Flipper, because I'd be on meetings all day and thus needed a simple accommodation in a low price. The first shock came shortly after I made the booking - my card was charged by the full amount of my reservation, even though the booking terms & conditions indicated payment upon arrival. After a week I got my money back, and the reservation appeared to be still "officially confirmed" (quote from e-mail I got). One month later (shortly before my trip to Amsterdam) I received an e-mail stating that my credit card is wrong and I'll lose my reservation if I don't send details of another one (via an e-mail - where's the security?) in 24 hours. I was in travel and since I didn't expect things like this to happen, I checked my email slightly after that period. I asked for explanation, since my card has been previously accepted and I didn't believe I provided wrong expiry date, like they suggested... The answer was quite ridiculous - they agreed my card was ok the first time (which obviously meant expiry date was fine - what a stupid excuse!), but they tried to charge it again and it didn't work now, so they cancelled my reservation. When I checked the website, the room was again available (on the day before hotel was fully booked), but for 165â‚¬ instead of 94â‚¬. Conclusions? They can charge your card when they're not supposed to do, leaving you without money (I was lucky I only booked one night - imagine you were coming with your family for entire week). They can ask for credit card details via e-mail, which basically means that if they charge it for no reason (like they apparently do), your bank most likely won't accept the complaint on fraudulent transaction and won't give you the money back, because sending the data by such an insecure means is basically considered holder's fault. Then, they can cancel your reservation in the last minute, forcing you to pay twice as much, because it's impossible to find a cheap room in such a short time. I strongly recommend avoiding this fraudulent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HÃ¶lle”
Reviews.Author: FilthyL F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. 1. Rooms are disgusting. They are awfully small, the walls are scratched. The bed takes 90% of the room. 2. The personal is rly unfriednly. 3. The worst part is, that they have authorised my money from my bank account without my agreement and have frozen it for 1 month so I had to force my bank to unfreez it. As a conclusion, I wish people to book better hotels, because this one doent even deserve to be booked. Atleast not for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Perfect Location !”
Reviews.Author: Selin93
Reviews.Content: Everything was awesome at these hotel ! Espacially the staff ! They were so nice people.Nice breakfest , clean rooms. But the best thing is the region where the hotel was located.It was perfect.Houses , river and the many others near hotel.You can reach the city centre easyly.Or take walk along the centre.Possible to see good restaurants , shops...I felt like I was walking down Little Manhattan.But small room :)

Reviews.Title: “Wrong Information over the phone”
Reviews.Author: gpflugWien
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel, but I had to cancel the booking. I did it over the internat and I phoned the reception. They told me that the cancellation was completely OK. However, since it was during the Konigin day, I had to pay the full amount, although I did not use it. I was not informed about this when I called two weeks before.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good value but know the slight drawbacks (esp. for card payments) beforehand”
Reviews.Author: mreza
Reviews.Content: Hotel Flipper is reasonably priced and American breakfast included, so it is good value for money in an expensive city like Amsterdam. The hotel is located some distance away from the city centre, but Tram 4 stops less than 5 minutes' walk away from the hotel. Travel passes can be purchased from the hotel, though they were one short when we (a group of four) asked. Check-in is very late (2 pm), but one can leave luggage if arriving before check-in time. The person on duty outside check-in hours seemed to be in a bit of a daze and started filling up a vending machine while we were trying to deposit our luggage, but otherwise the staff were very helpful. The beds are narrow, but we were prepared for that after reading other reviews. Our quadruple room had a private shower but a shared toilet (as advertised), though the toilet was opposite our room so this was less of a nuisance than it sounded. The shower and toilet were a bit cramped though. In the evening there was a smell of weed from one of the neighbouring rooms, but I suppose the hotel couldn't do much about that. The hotel bill must be settled at least the day before checking out. This was not advertised at the time of booking. Nor was the fact that there is a 5% extra charge on all credit or debit card payments. (The 5% city tax was advertised at the time of booking, though.)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Amsterdam, but small!”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldShuggie
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are very small indeed, but clean and comfortable, showers hot, but again a tight fit. I know some of the reviews here are negative, but you've got to bear in mind many/most budget hotels in Amsterdam (especially in the central station area) are complete dives, dirty, noisy and only catering for stag/drug/sex tourists. Flipper being slightly out of the centre, but an easy tram ride or even a pleasant walk, is in a very quite and charming area, which still has more local bars and restaurants around it. Staff are friendly and the breakfast was excellent- unlimited quantities of cheeses, meats and eggs- certainly better than the standard stale croissant. So if you just want a base to crash this please is the one to go for.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: WeatheredTravellers
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop in Continental Europe and it is truly an abomination. Rooms are cupboard size, seriously!!! The photo's on the websites are of rooms you probably wont be staying in Do not be fooled!! Do not trust Venere.com

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever been”
Reviews.Author: ynykon
Reviews.Content: Very very small double rooms (about 2x3 meter), dirty, old furniture No place enough to put your trunk, to get to the window you have walk over the the bed. We stayed there 2 nights and left the hotel as soon as possible in the morning and came back later to spend there possible few time. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone, please avoid it. It is not worth any single cent

Reviews.Title: “very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: johnxSomerset
Reviews.Content: Service was good . Room was basic but did the job, price was good for location. Breakfast was good

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: lalka1982
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on Trip Advisor before I left and as I opened the room door I immediately said "It's not bad at all" -mostly because it was clean and neat. We were there 3 nights and began to notice problems. The beds (single ones) are VERY narrow - even for single beds and I kept bashing into the wall as I turned at night. It feels more like a hostel than a hotel - the people on the desk, although polite do not give off a hotel vibe and there is a defineite feeling of a lack of security. The guests are very much a mixed crowd - some lovely people and then some odd, intimidating characters. On the last night there were 3 guys in the room next to us who would stare at us as we walked by. Then on the last night they were up all night chatting and laughing loudly through the paper thin walls. My partner went to the shared toliet at 3am and said there was one guy sitting in the hall outside our bedroom and the room door with the other guys in it was wide open. Very intimidating at 3am. The location is ok although not great (10-15mins by tram into centre) and honestly, it wasn't worth the price we were paying. Later we stayed in far nicer hotels in amsterdam for a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Awful. Staff have no shame.”
Reviews.Author: bikeveloce
Reviews.Content: They were out of double rooms, so we booked a single for the first night. Singles are â‚¬50, and doubles are â‚¬69. However, they insisted on charging us â‚¬75 for the single room! Their explanation is â‚¬50 plus â‚¬25 for the extra person. When I pointed out that it doesn't make sense to charge us more for a single room, the receptionist just looked at us and said it's their "policy." They have no shame in screwing over their customers for an extra buck. The room is TINY! 8 feet by 8 feet. I'm sleeping on the floor, with my wife in the bed. We are paying equivalent of $100 for this???? The walls are paper thin and there is lots of banging on our wall at 8am from someone doing work in a storage room or something! The bathroom is in the hallway. A nightmare! I should have checked tripadvisor first!

Reviews.Title: “awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Becky093
Reviews.Content: This was a terrible hotel. The first thing happened before we even went on holiday, we had booked a double room for 3 nights, which they rang and said they had no double room for the first night but we could have one for the second and third nights so on the first night we couldnt unpack and had to pack again the next day so we could move rooms. When we got to the hotel we were told we could not get in the room until 6 or 7 pm (bear in mind we had to get up at 3 the morning before to get our flights so were very tired) so my boyfriend was very angry and we ended up waiting in reception and they let us in at 4 saying it was all ready :S The third thing was the night before we were due to leave very early in the morning in the middle of the night there was lots and shouting and banging right outside our room and we were told that it was 'spanish druggies' and the receptionist could not control them, a very bad nights sleep. The rooms were also completely lacking in space to move around. The only good thing about this hotel was the breakfast which was okay.

Reviews.Title: “A total nightmare”
Reviews.Author: PumuckelGlasgow
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we have seen. Even at the cheapest rate of Â£52 per night, flipper is way too expensive. flipper is a total nightmare!!! The rooms look more like cupboards. We had a reservation for 4 nights but when we saw our rooms we opt to cancel our room and run back to a new hotel near amstelstation (casa400), where we chose to sleep for friday evening because flipper was charging Â£85 per night for a single room shared bathroom which was ridiculous for the conditions of the hotel. The whole experience going to the doorsteps of flipper is a robbery. After showing them how depressed we are with the rooms and how misleading the pictures are on the internet (on hotel booking sites like venere.com) and we are not paying for this, they still made us pay for this which according to them was cancellation policy. After all the arguing and bargaining, they offered us that they will not charge us if they can offer the rooms. we do not have the chance of knowing this. But anyway this was a cold lie because they have already credited it to my card once we left the premises. We should have read the reviews from other booking websites, if we did we should not have booked this hotel. we should have taken pictures of the rooms they offered and place it on the web. if we have gone to Tripadvisor, this should have not happened

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: coults
Reviews.Content: We were given a 3 person room but had only booked a 2 person room. The room had tea making facilities and a very large shower. Everywhere was very clean. The staff were very nice and helpful. The breakfast was very nice. My husband liked the lovely bowl of sweets in the recepition. We would stay again and recommend to anyone. Elaine and Neville Coult

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: bernerd252
Reviews.Content: If you're the type of person that likes a relaxing holiday with plenty of sleep, don't go to this hotel. We were on the top floor and could hear every door slam, everytime someone opened or closed it. The walls are also paper thin- so yeah we could hear the people pissing in the toilet in the room next to ours. Don't try sleeping between 6:30 am and 9 there's just too much noise throughout the hotel. The "breakfast" was a joke as well, if you like toast and boiled eggs it's fine, but don't hope for anything more. They seemed to be having cleaner issues as well.

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: BattleFlag
Reviews.Content: Hotel Flipper is not the worst accomodation out there and its not the best. We had a 3 person room with a bathroom which was on the bottom floor. We made plenty of noise, got no complaints and couldn't hear anyone in the other rooms. They don't give you our own key, you have to drop into reception on your way out. There is also a â‚¬30 deposit on the room, 5% city tax and if you use a credit card another 5% charge on top of that. Breakfast was continental and served until 10am. Amstel Station is about 600m from the hostel and another tram outside that goes straight to the city center

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! WHAT A LET DOWN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sumuffin
Reviews.Content: We walked into the hotel and there was water coming in from the ceiling and construction guys everywhere. Our first night the guys fixing the ceiling and the rest of the building started work at 6am!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It was horrible!!! They wanted money up front and were poor on "cleaning" themselves, they didnt smell good. They wouldnt let you have your own personal key which was werid. To much money for this place. SMALL ROOMS!!! I would have rather slept in the bathroom, it was much nicer then the room! The only good thing was it is a small walk to the Tram 4 to the central part of town. Other then that.... YOU CAN FIND BETTER!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst value for money hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: RobCambridge
Reviews.Content: Truely awful hotel. Hotel staff wanted all the money up front and even included a 5% "Amsterdam sales tax" and preceeded to lie saying that "even ATMs charge a 5%" - clearly total lies. This was never mentioned when we booked online. Attempts to pay by card were also greated with "that'll be another 5%" - a total joke. Massively overpriced (even when we dodged the 5% nonsense) and a little too out of town. It's doable, but an annoying 10-12euro taxi into town. Breakfast was pretty poor. We had to leave a deposit for any room damage (30euros), although I don't think anything in the room is worth as much as that. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, money went missing”
Reviews.Author: mrbean40
Reviews.Content: room was small , and dirty, beds narrow and soft. went out for a cigarette and when we went back to our room money had been taken from our wallets.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped, Gloomy, Depressing, Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Swoodhall
Reviews.Content: The hotels location is within a good distance to the RAI, but if you are planning on going to central Amsterdam then this hotel is a bit to far out of town, you can walk there but, takes about an hour and a half. Upon arriving at the Flipper (mid Saturday afternoon), we were confronted with a locked front door and had to be interrogated through an intercom, before we were aloud inside. Inside we had to pay in cash due to the 5% charge if you pay by card. We also had to pay a further â‚¬20 deposit for a card to hold up at the window each time you come back to the hotel, to skip the interrogation process. We had reserved a twin room with a shared bathroom, which was up two incredibly steep flights of stairs. The actual room was ridiculously small in size, more like a cupboard, the room had a sink on the wall which took 10 minutes to drain and also leaked. The shared bathroom was right next door to our room, but it was again ridiculously small in size, was very dimly lit, and the shower head had nowhere to fix it onto the wall. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was nice. The room cost us â‚¬195 for two nights which is absolute robbery for the quality of this hostel, I mean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and you'll probably be robbed”
Reviews.Author: angies-eye-patch
Reviews.Content: Well first of all the hotel itself wasn't so bad. Our room was nice and we paid extra to have a private bathroom which was clean. We were, however, disgusted to come back to our room from breakfast and find that money had been taken from each of our wallets. From that point on we took everything of value with us whenever we went out. The hotel also charges a 5% fee for paying by card (credit or debit) so if you do decide to stay there, pay in cash. Overall it's far too expensive for such a basic hotel and it seems they'll try to get money out of you in any way possible. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, a little pokey, and robbed on the first night.”
Reviews.Author: t00k3r
Reviews.Content: We arrived before check-in time, and assumed that the hotel would have a secure room where bags and luggage could be left safely. Unfortunatley this is not the case. The receptionist expected us to leave our bags (unattended) in the reception area. We then tried to pay with a Maestro (debit) card. The receptionist informed us that we would have to pay an extra 5% charge to use our card. While we would have been happy to accept this for using a credit card, we were using a debit card. This is ridiculous. They did however, offer us an option to pay by cash. The room was small, but comfortable (we booked a twin room with an ensuite bathroom), there was a TV with lots of channels, and the bathroom was small, but it was clean. A buffet breakfast is included in the price, and whilst we were down having breakfast someone (the cleaner?) took 20 euros from each of our wallets (which we left in our rooms). As we counted out our money the previous night, we are absolutely certain money was stolen. If you choose to stay here, I strongly suggest that you count all money, and check all personal posessions every night, and every time you come back to the room. I dont recommend leaving a wallet in the room (probably not a good idea anyway :) and be prepared to face hidden charges. The breakfast is nothing to write home about either.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Book It...”
Reviews.Author: KatyK80
Reviews.Content: My sister & I stayed here during the IBC exhibition -- we were charged 635 euros for a 3 night stay (the price was hiked up because of the IBC) -- usual price 225 euros - don't even book it at this price -- the place is a mess - dirty, dark smelly -- the location is OK for the RAI -- but coming back to the hotel from the city centre was scary - its in a residential area & who knows who was lurking in the small park area at the top of the street -- our friends stayed at Bed & Breakfast Fort - check this out -- it was a fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in 30 years of coming to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: treats
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the worst we have ever stayed in during 30 years of visiting Amsterdam. The room was dirty, the shower and lighting didn't work properly, the furniture was falling apart. The fire exits were blocked with furniture, the heating didn't work, the was not enough tables to seat guests for breakfast, the free internet was chargeable, the ground floor room was on the first floor, no disabled facilities, price charged was not as agreed when booking. This is definitiely one to avoid !

Reviews.Title: “Should be a 3 star !”
Reviews.Author: WestsTests
Reviews.Content: Great value for money Clean and friendly. Tram 4 takes 8 minutes to get to Central Station and the stop is on the end of the road around the corner. quiet area - thankfully - good to get away from the noise at night. pleanty of bars and eateries within 5 minutes walk. Thouroughly recomended swestcardiff@aol.com

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Flipper
HotelInfo.Address: Borssenburgstraat 1-5, Amsterdam 3021 CJ, The Netherlands
